info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:00PM EDT until September 08 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR PERSON...NORTHEASTERN ORANGE...GRANVILLE AND NORTHERN DURHAM COUNTIES... At 459 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Butner, or 7 miles west of Creedmoor, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. RDU International Airport reported a wind gust to 76 mph at 421 PM. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Durham, Roxboro, Hillsborough, Creedmoor, Butner, Rougemont, Concord, Stem, Lake Michie and Eno River State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
